result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Earl Smith Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Earl Smith Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Charles Earl Smith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 12-8-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 12-14-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Earl Smith Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz appeared by video for Charles Earl Smith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense does not have discovery and an offer and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 10-13-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Melvin J or Courtney Danielle N. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charles Earl Smith Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Charles Earl Smith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Grant Ian Huebner appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. For reasons stated on the record. Court dismissed enhancer to count 3. State to file amended complaint by next court date.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
